description: From Middle English translatour, from Old French translator, translatour, translateur, from Latin trānslātor, agent noun from perfect passive participle trānslātus, from trānsferō (“carry across”), from trans (“across, beyond”) + ferō (“bear, carry”).

entries.meaning: A person who converts speech, text, film, or other material into a different language. (Contrasted with interpreter.)
(by extension) One that makes a new version of a source material in a different language or format.
A computer program that translates something from one language to another using machine translation.
